page.title: 11Sawston Health Centre
page.content: Sawston's Health Centre opened in April 1969, caring for 11000 people. Now in June 1985 it cares for 13500.It is a spacious building with 8 doctors' surgeries; offices and treatment rooms.48 people work there altogether. The nurses alone treat 30-60 patients a day and the doctors many more.6 voluntary workers run a toy library,while nurses run ante-natal and post-natal clinics. The physiotherapist and speech therapist are part time. The mid-wife does home visits as well as her work at the centre.the school nurse spends a lot of time in the pharmacy which sells medecines. 250 people use the centre every day including the workers.Latest equipment includes a table for minor operations donated by Old Addenbrookes Hospital and an operating lamp donated by Sawston Fire Brigade.
